tool.name: Scanpy FindVariableGenes
tool.description: based on normalised dispersion of expression

param.name: min_mean
param.label: Min value for normalised mean expression (in log1p scale), ignored if flavor='seurat_v3'

param.name: max_mean
param.label: Max value for normalised mean expresssion (in log1p scale), Ignored if flavor='seurat_v3'

param.name: min_disp
param.label: Min value for dispersion of expression, ignored if flavor='seurat_v3'

param.name: max_disp
param.label: Max value for dispersion of expresssion, ignored if flavor='seurat_v3'

param.name: n_top_gene
param.label: Number of top variable genes to keep, mandatory if flavor='seurat_v3'

param.name: span
param.label: The fraction of the data (cells) used when estimating the variance in the loess model fit if flavor='seurat_v3'

param.name: n_bin
param.label: Number of bins for binning the mean expression

param.name: filter
param.label: Remove genes not marked as highly variable
param.help: When set, inplace subset to highly-variable genes, otherwise only flag highly-variable genes.

param.name: batch_key
param.label: Batch key
param.help: If specified, highly-variable genes are selected within each batch separately and merged. This simple process avoids the selection of batch-specific genes and acts as a lightweight batch correction method. For all flavors, genes are first sorted by how many batches they are a HVG. For dispersion-based flavors ties are broken by normalized dispersion. If flavor = 'seurat_v3', ties are broken by the median (across batches) rank based on within-batch normalized variance.
